plugins.name: Variable Collection Creator
plugins.description:

This plugin helps you generate standardized Variable collections in seconds, following best practices for scalable, token-based design.


Includes ready-to-use presets for:

‚úÖ Spacing

‚úÖ Typography (Font Size, Line Height, Letter Spacing)

‚úÖ Padding

‚úÖ Size

And you can also create Custom sets.


Whether you're building a system from scratch or documenting an existing one, this plugin helps eliminate repetitive tasks and keeps your Variables organized and scalable.

plugins.name: PRE: AI Design Review
plugins.description:
PRE helps designers and product teams understand how users will interact with their UI designs ‚Äî before a single line of code is written.


üîπ Select any frame in Figma and click ‚ÄúUpload Selected Frame‚Äù to send it to PRE.

üîπ PRE will automatically generate a heatmap, predict click-through rates, and provide UX suggestions using AI.

üîπ You can modify the generated tags, draw additional clickable elements, or toggle the heatmap overlay on and off using the second button in the top bar.

üîπ Once you're happy with the predictions, you can download the heatmap and click data for further analysis or presentation.


Whether you're working on early wireframes or high-fidelity mocks, PRE helps you make design decisions backed by predictive user analytics ‚Äî all from right inside Figma.


Powered by PRE
plugins.tagline: Export any Figma frame and instantly generate heatmaps, CTR predictions and UX feedback with PRE.

plugins.name: Fillio - Elevate design with dynamic content
plugins.description:
Fillio - Less Typing, More Designing


Fillio is the simplest way to populate your Figma designs with realistic {{placeholder}} content. Whether you‚Äôre working on wireframes, prototypes, invoices, brand books, or daily UI design, Fillio saves you time by instantly filling your artboards with dynamic content.



Key Features:


Quick & Easy Filling:

Fill your designs with placeholders like names, addresses, and all type of contents in a single click.


Customizable Placeholders:

Use simple tags like {{name}} or {{Date}} to create dynamic content that fits your design.


Efficient Workflow:

Skip the tedious task of manually adding content‚Äîlet Fillio do the heavy lifting.


Perfect for Prototypes & Wireframes:

Make your designs look polished even in early stages, without all the manual effort.



How it Works:


  1. Install Fillio from the Figma Community.
  2. Select the elements or frames where you want to add placeholders.
  3. Define Your Placeholders using simple tags like {{name}} or {{Type}}.
  4. Click ‚ÄúSubmit‚Äù, and Fillio automatically adds content to your design.



Get Started with Fillio Today!

accepted.name: Mohammed M.Akasha
accepted.description: A User-centered Designer who crafts meaningful products through design.

plugins.tagline: Less Filling.. More designing.

plugins.name: Lexi: Localize & Translate your design
plugins.description:
Design once‚Äîtranslate instantly. Lexi automates text translation in your Figma frames while keeping your layout intact. Perfect for multilingual apps, marketing assets, and App/Play Store screenshots.


üöÄ Why Lexi?

50+ languages ‚Äì Translate your designs into multiple languages in seconds.

Batch translation ‚Äì Select multiple frames & languages at once.

Seamless workflow ‚Äì Translated frames stay organized with clear naming.



üîß How It Works

Select your frames ‚Äì Pick the designs you need to translate.

Choose your languages ‚Äì Supports all major languages, including English, Spanish, Japanese, Arabic, and more.

Translate with AI ‚Äì Lexi uses OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-3.5 Turbo for high-quality, natural translations.

Get organized output ‚Äì New frames are created, named with language codes, and maintain the original design structure.


üîí Best Practices

Font compatibility ‚Äì If a language isn't displaying correctly, try swapping fonts to Roboto or Inter for best results.


Who is Lexi for?

üåé Designers working on global products.

üì± Teams creating multi-language UI/UX designs.

plugins.name: Set Gradient Style
plugins.description:
The plugin allows you to transfer the parameters of a new gradient to previously published styles, simplifying the process of manually transferring angles and breakpoints. This may be necessary if you need to update the current style, but doing it manually will cause.


  1. Select a Frame, Rectangle or Vector with a new gradient
  2. Write local style name which you want to update
  3. Press "Set style"

plugins.name: Type Rhythm
plugins.description:
A simple plugin for efficiently adjusting typography in Figma. You can increase or decrease font size in 8px increments, and adjust line height in 10% increments. It also allows you to convert Auto line height to 150%. Using tools like Keyboard Maestro to set up shortcuts can enhance your workflow.

plugins.name: Button Genie Pro
plugins.description:
Welcome to Button Genie Pro, the Figma plugin that instantly generates a fully featured button component set with every variant, state and Token, so you can focus on design, not tedious setup.


https://geniepro.app/


Quick Start


1. Create a new page in your Figma file where you want to place your button component set.

2. Run the plugin: Search for Button Genie Pro.

3. Follow the two-step UI to create variables and generate buttons.



Create Variables Foundations


On the first screen of the plugin, a single click generates 5 variable collections to lay the foundation of your button system. This makes updating your buttons much more flexible:

00 Primitives

01 Style Tokens

02 Semantic Colors

03 Sizing Tokens

04 Component Tokens

05 Typography



Preview and Generate Button Set


1. Light and Dark Mode: See your Primary, Secondary, and Tertiary buttons side by side in Light and Dark Mode. When you choose your Light or Dark Base Color, Button Genie Pro will automatically define the reverted color. (You can always tweaks colors later in your Figma Variables section).

2. Real-time Contrast Check always make sure your text meets WCAG AA or AAA standards.

3. Customize:

- Button text

- Stroke width for secondary button

- Horizontal/vertical padding, gap, and border radius

- Toggle variants: hover, focus, selected, disabled

- Add icon-only or pill-shaped buttons

4. Create Button Set: Click to generate up to 360 variants (3 types √ó 5 states √ó 2 shapes √ó 3 sizes √ó 4 content variants), a set of semantic buttons (Success, Warning, Error), and a set of placeholder icons. The base color you choose will be added to your custom color scale (myColor/randomName/50‚Äì900) in the Primitives variable collection.



Use Your Button Component


- All generated buttons are grouped into component sets in your document.

- Drag instances onto any frame and override text or icon as needed.

- Variables keep your design tokens flexible: update a token to cascade changes through every button.



Troubleshooting


- If you don't see new components:

  1. Ensure you've correctly generated variables/tokens at the first screen, before generating your button set.
  2. This plugin needs a Figma paid subscription to create Variable Modes. Make sure your have one. If not, the plugin will not work as expected.

- For manual hex input issues, make sure to include a leading `#` and six hex digits.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generates fully featured button component sets with variants & variables (tokens).

plugins.name: Text Styles to Variables
plugins.description:
PLUGIN CRAFTED FOR REFOKUS


Plugin Documentation

This plugin extracts font-related properties from your local text styles and converts them into reusable variables. It automatically applies the following variables:

‚Ä¢Font size

‚Ä¢Font weight

‚Ä¢Font family


Additionally, the plugin documents‚Äîbut does not apply‚Äîthe following properties:

‚Ä¢Line height

‚Ä¢Letter spacing


This is due to a current Figma limitation: dynamic variables for these properties are not yet supported. As a workaround, these values are stored as string variables for documentation purposes only.


For example:

If the original line-height is 100%, the plugin will store it as a variable with:

variableName: 100%, variableValue: 1em (calculated as 100 √∑ 100 √ó 1em)


Naming Convention for text styles:


To ensure accurate detection and conversion, your text styles should follow this naming structure:

‚Ä¢Use the prefix title- followed by a number (e.g., title-1) for headings

‚Ä¢Use the prefix text- followed by a number (e.g., text-2) for paragraphs


You can also use suffixes to describe combo classes. For instance:

‚Ä¢text-2-buttonLabel


This will still be recognized as a text-2 style with additional contextual information.
plugins.tagline: By Fede Luna

plugins.name: Link Spacing & Radius Variables (Alpha)
plugins.description:
One-click application of variables to selected objects


Important: Variable Requirements

1. Variables must be in an external library (local variables are not supported yet)

2. The library must be connected to your file


Variable Naming Requirements:

For Spacing:

- Format: `space-{number}`

- Examples: `space-4`, `space-8`, `space-16`, `space-24`

- Variable value must match the number in the name

For Radius:

- Format: `radius-{number}`

- Examples: `radius-4`, `radius-8`, `radius-16`

- Variable value must match the number in the name


Collection Requirements:

- Spacing collection must include the word "spacing" in its name

- Radius collection must include the word "radius" or "border-radius" in its name


How to Prepare Your File

1. Connect the variable library:

- Open "Team Library" menu

- Find the required library

- Enable the toggle next to the "Variables" section

2. Ensure objects are prepared:

- For spacing: objects must use Auto Layout

- For radius: objects must support the cornerRadius property


How to Use

1. Select objects you want to apply variables to

2. Launch the plugin

3. Choose the desired collection from the dropdown (marked with üìö icon)

4. Click "Apply spacing" or "Apply radius"
plugins.tagline: Link spacing and radius variables

plugins.name: Lumos Design Toolkit
plugins.description:
Lumos Design Toolkit is a powerful Figma plugin that streamlines your design workflow by providing essential tools for managing design systems, variables, text styles, and file organization. It helps designers maintain consistency, save time, and improve collaboration across design projects.


‚ú® Key Features


üé® Variables Management

‚Ä¢Import from JSON ‚Äì Bring your design tokens into Figma with just a few clicks

‚Ä¢Light & Dark Mode Support ‚Äì Import variables for multiple modes effortlessly

‚Ä¢Smart Conflict Handling ‚Äì Choose to overwrite, skip, or rename existing variables

‚Ä¢Organize with Collections ‚Äì Group and manage your variables into clean collections


üìù Text Styles

‚Ä¢Create Custom Styles ‚Äì Define fonts, sizes, weights, and line heights that match your system

‚Ä¢Apply in One Click ‚Äì Select a text layer and apply styles instantly

‚Ä¢Live Preview ‚Äì See exactly how your styles will look before creating

‚Ä¢Full Style Control ‚Äì View, apply, or delete styles from a single interface


üìÑ Page Management

‚Ä¢Quick Page Creation ‚Äì Add new pages without the manual setup

‚Ä¢Batch Mode ‚Äì Create multiple pages at once by listing names line-by-line

‚Ä¢Organize with Ease ‚Äì Rename, reorder, and delete pages from one place


üöÄ Starter Templates

‚Ä¢Working File Structure ‚Äì Automatically generate pages like Cover, Research, Drafts, and Final Designs

‚Ä¢Design System Setup ‚Äì Instantly build a system with pages for Typography, Colors, Components, Layouts, Templates, and Docs

plugins.name: Zuuvi Export Service
plugins.description:
Zuuvi Export Service is a Figma plugin designed to integrate Figma with Zuuvi‚Äôs Studio platform, making it easier and more efficient for designers who work with both tools. The plugin helps reduce the need to manually recreate designs in Studio after first mocking them up in Figma. While built around Figma‚Äôs capabilities, the exported result aims to reflect the original design as closely as possible within the constraints of Studio‚Äôs features.


Easily export ad creatives from Figma directly into your Zuuvi workspace - ready for production, personalisation, and cross-channel publishing.

  2. ÂõæÂÉèÂ∞ÜÊòæÁ§∫Âú®Âõ∫ÂÆöÂ§ßÂ∞èÁöÑÈ¢ÑËßàÊ°ÜÂÜÖÔºåÁº©ÊîæËÆæÁΩÆ‰ºöÊ†πÊçÆÊÇ®ÁöÑÂºÄÂÖ≥ÈÄâÊã©ËøõË°åÂ∫îÁî®„ÄÇ
  3. Êèí‰ª∂Êìç‰Ωú‰æùËµñ‰∫é Figma ÁîªÂ∏É‰∏äÁöÑÈÄâ‰∏≠ÂÖÉÁ¥†ÔºåËØ∑Á°Æ‰øùÂú®‰ΩøÁî®Êèí‰ª∂ÂâçÈÄâ‰∏≠Ê≠£Á°ÆÁöÑÂÖÉÁ¥†„ÄÇ


Introduction

Image Size Integration allows Figma users to efficiently manage and integrate images within frames, groups, and components. With this plugin, you can adjust image sizes and apply uniform dimensions for a consistent design output.


Function Description

  1. Allows users to select multiple elements (Frames, Groups, Components, Text, Instances, etc.) in a Figma design.
  2. Automatically calculates the maximum width and height from the selected elements.
  3. Displays each selected image inside a preview box, either maintaining its original size or resizing it based on the longest side, as determined by the user's settings.
  4. A toggle feature to switch between maintaining the image's original size or scaling it to fit the preview box.
  5. Supports flexible control over how images are displayed within their allocated preview space.


How to Use

  1. Select the elements (Frames, Groups, Text, Components, Instances, etc.) you want to preview and adjust.
  2. Click the "Generate Base64 Preview" button to create image previews.
  3. Use the toggle to switch between keeping the image‚Äôs original size or scaling it to fit the preview box.
  4. View the adjusted images and their corresponding dimensions directly within the plugin's interface.


Notes

  1. The plugin supports both raster images and vector elements.
  2. Images will be displayed in a fixed-size preview box, and resizing settings apply based on your toggle choice.
  3. The plugin works with selected elements in Figma's canvas, so ensure you have the right items selected before applying the tool.

plugins.name: TapTail
plugins.description:
üòå No explicit sign-ups, logins or permissions are required to use TapTail. Just run the plugin!

Use this example prototype created by Figma to try: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets


TapTail brings real usability data into Figma with minimal effort. Install the plugin, create a prototype sharing link, share the link with your subjects and start collecting metrics. Once you collected enough data (at least one session), you will be able to generate a report directly in your prototype's Figma document (on a separate page).


üí¨ Feedback and questions (I read and reply to every e-mail): laci@taptail.com

‚ô•Ô∏è Found it useful? A 'Like' would mean the world to me! :)


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


Tired of bouncing between Figma and external usability test tools? With TapTail, you can see metrics directly in Figma:

  1. Session details: Total time spent, time to first click , count of unique sessions and more.
  2. Click positions: Numbered circles on each frame show exactly where and in what order users tapped.
  3. Interaction density: How many taps landed on each screen, helping you spot hot and cold zones.
  4. Labels: Add a tag when copying links to know which channel drove each test.


Your original designs stay untouched: all results are exported on a separate page and overlaid on separate layers of your designs' clones.


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


üõü How to use

A very detailed, step-by-step guide on how to create a sharing link and a report:


Creating a sharing link:

  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Click the blue 'Create' button.
  3. Provide a 'Name' and your Figma prototype's sharing URL (simply copy like you normally would and paste it here) then click the blue 'Create' button at the bottom. Once done, it will show you a list with the created item on top.
  4. Click the item's link icon to copy the TapTail sharing link: it will ask if you'd like to track the link (this is optional but recommended: use only numbers and lowercase, english alphabet letters without spaces).
  5. Click the blue 'Copy link [...]' button. Sharing link is now copied on your clipboard.
  6. Share the link with your test subjects. When they open it in their browser, your prototype will appear like the original Figma prototype (as if you would shared from the figma.com link).


Report generation:

  1. Run the plugin in the same Figma document where the shared prototype is located (this is important ‚ùóÔ∏è).
  2. You can check for new sessions with the 'Refresh' link on the top right corner.
  3. Once you have at least 1 session, you can create a report by pressing the 'Play' button.
  4. A confirmation pop-up will appear first. If you confirm, report generation will start and a loading indicator will appear (normally a report generation takes a few seconds, but could be more depending on your machine's computational capacity and the volume of the collected data).
  5. Report is generated on a new page in the document.


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


‚è≥ License & Trial

TapTail is currently in open beta, therefore all features and functions are free for a limited period of time! Feedbacks, questions, bug reports: please and thank you ü§ó


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


üîê Data handling & privacy

TapTail does NOT need access to your name, e-mail, files, comments, projects, components or styles to work. It only needs a very limited set of data to function:


Your identity

  1. Your Figma user ID is stored, but only in a scrambled form called a hash. A hash is like a one-way fingerprint: can't turn it back into the real ID. Your ID is needed to assign your account the free license.
  2. Other identity related data is only needed if you buy a license, then at least a billing name, billing address and an e-mail address is required.


Your prototype link

Your Figma prototype sharing URL (copied from Figma, provided by you manually) must be stored so your prototype can be served for your users via the TapTail sharing link (which looks like this: https://ux.taptail.com/s/<handle>). Part of the prototype link is a string called the 'file key' (format: https://www.figma.com/proto/<file key>/‚Ä¶) which identifies your Figma document. Since the prototype sharing URL is stored, the file key is also stored (as part of the URL). Read more about the implications here and here.


Prototype emitted events

List of Figma emitted events that are captured (with timestamp + data such as node ID, click and scroll cooridnates, etc. ‚Äì for more info, click the event name below):

  1. MOUSE_PRESS_OR_RELEASE
  2. PRESENTED_NODE_CHANGED
  3. INITIAL_LOAD
  4. NEW_STATE
  5. REQUEST_CLOSE
  6. LOGIN_SCREEN_SHOWN
  7. PASSWORD_SCREEN_SHOWN


This data is only used to build your in-Figma reports and are never shared with anyone else.

You can learn more about embeds in general here: Embed Figma Files.


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


üöß Roadmap & new features

In no particular order, directly from my todo list:

  1. define expiration date+time;
  2. define simple instructions/ welcome screen;
  3. designated success screen (to enable missions);
  4. component variant change handling;
  5. data export in structured form (like JSON, CSV, ‚Ä¶);
  6. <your ideas maybe? get in touch!>


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


ü™≥ Found a bug? Got feedback? Have an idea for a feature?

E-mail me at laci@taptail.com!

I read and reply to every e-mail :)


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


ü´∂ Credits

  1. The prototype used for demo in the video: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets

plugins.name: Freaking Fake Data
plugins.description:
About plugin:

Freaking Fake Data simplifies your design workflow in Figma, FigJam and Slides by letting you fill mockups with custom, project-specific data instead of random content. Take control of your text layers, create tailored datasets and unify data formats for your design team ‚Äî perfect for consistent names, phone numbers or other details. Working locally, it boosts productivity and eliminates errors while speeding up mockup creation.


Key Features:

  1. Effortless Mockup Filling: Quickly populate text layers with your data.
  2. Unified Team Data: Import a CSV or JSON file for team consistency.
  3. Bulk Text Magic: Mass-apply text to layers with one click.
  4. Cross-Platform Support: Works in Figma, FigJam and Slides.
  5. Easy Data Import: Upload CSV or JSON files instantly.
  6. Default Data Option: Test with preloaded samples (e.g., names, cities).


How to Use:

  1. Import Data: Create a table in a tool like Google Sheets or Excel, fill it with data, export as CSV or JSON, and upload‚Äîor use default data. Import multiple files and switch via tabs.
  2. Select Text Layers: Highlight the text layers to apply data to.
  3. Apply Data: Pick a column (e.g., "First Name") and apply data. Choose order:
  4. Sort: Inserts data in table order.
  5. Random: Inserts data in random order.
  6. Explore Options: Switch tabs, view rows, or use "Set as Default" to save a tab for next launch.


How to Create a Table:

  1. Enter data in columns (e.g., "First Name" in one, "City" in another); the first row becomes button names.
  2. Add separators by leaving a column empty with "---" or "- - -" in the header for a line or use "//Special Offers" or "// Special Offers" for a labeled group divider. (example: telegram)


Perfect for prototypes, presentations or team projects ‚Äî try it now!
plugins.tagline: Fill Mockups Quickly ‚Äî use unified data for your design team. Massively paste your text into Figma

plugins.name: Spacing and radius fixer
plugins.description:
Auto-fix spacing & radius

Plugin that automatically rounds spacing and radius values to the nearest preset value in Auto Layout objects.


What it does

- Rounds gap and padding values to the nearest preset spacing

- Rounds corner radius to the nearest preset radius

- Works with any Auto Layout object (frames, components, instances)


Presets

Default values (can be customized in plugin):

Spacing: 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 20, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 80 (px)

Radius: 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 20, 100 (px)


How to use

1. Select Auto Layout object(s)

2. Run the plugin

3. Switch between Spacing/Radius modes

4. Customize presets if needed (or use Reset to restore defaults)

5. Click Apply
plugins.tagline: Fixes inconsistent spacing and radius values by rounding them to the nearest preset

plugins.name: dpicon - SVG Icons
plugins.description:
dpicon is a Figma plugin that provides 944 high-quality filled SVG icons for your design projects. Whether you're creating wireframes, prototypes, or polished UI designs, dpicon makes it easy to find and insert the perfect icon. Search for icons by name, double-click to place them on the canvas, or drag and drop for precise placement. With a sleek grid view and real-time search, dpicon streamlines your workflow and boosts productivity.


Key Features:

- 944 filled SVG icons, ready to use.

- Real-time search to quickly find icons.

- Double-click to place icons on the canvas.

- Lightweight and optimized for performance.


Perfect for designers looking to add professional icons to their Figma projects with ease.

Why OS Converter?

Designers are often faced with a choice:

plugins.name: Feedback Factory - Generate Feedback Screens from Spreadsheet Data
plugins.description:
The Feedback Factory is a plugin designed to streamline the creation of feedback screen variants from spreadsheet data.


Here's how to use it:


1. Upload Excel File üìÇ: Start by uploading an spreadsheet file containing feedback types and their respective content. The plugin will process this data to generate feedback variants.


2. Create Variants üé®: Add up to 10 variants by selecting a feedback type for each one. The plugin allows you to customize titles, descriptions, and button texts for each variant.


3. Generate Components üöÄ: Once your variants are set, click "Create Variants" to automatically generate the feedback components in Figma. The plugin will clone the selected frame or component and update the text elements based on the spreadsheet data.


This tool is perfect for designers looking to efficiently manage and create multiple feedback screens with consistent styling and content.
plugins.tagline: Generate feedback screens in Figma from spreadsheet data with ease and efficiency.
